data.title: Tasty and reasonably priced in a nice atmosphere
data.text:
The sushi was very tasty, and reasonably priced.  I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and the decor which felt like an old Japanese restaurant, rather than some new and shiny conveyor establishment.

This place does have a conveyor but only a few dishes were served on it.  I ordered from the waitress or the sushi staff directly.

The menu is a little limited in the nigiri and sashimi but it's enough variety unless you insist on order 8 or 10 different dishes.   Plenty of sushi rolls but I didn't order any.  They also serve not only ramen and udon but also soba.  In Japan these typically don't occur in the same restaurant so it' fun to see the triumvirate here.  

I went here for dinner on a Monday around 7:30 p.m. and the place was only about 1/4 busy.  That was enough to keep the sushi fresh and the waitresses active.   Apparently they are much busier at lunch time.  It's about a 1/2 block from the University.

Overall it was a satisfying and relaxed meal, and I'd happily return.

data.title: Fresh, clean Japanese food.
data.text: No fusion here. Just good, simple Japanese fare. We think it is the best in the triangle for health, taste and great value. Great during school breaks for quieter meals. Atmosphere Brings back our college days. But service is very polite, as are clientele. Our go-to when craving the cuisine. No need for gimmicks here like 'bogo' since it is beyond reasonable. Kudos.

data.title: Amazing Hibachi
data.text: This place never disappoints, the staff and cooks are very accommodating and respectful. It's worth the wait! Have to say Karamazov is one of my favorite dining spots when I'm in town.

data.title: Fun and Flavorable Sushi!
data.text:
This is the type of Japanese restaurant everyone enjoys -- sushi is freshly made and placed on plates on a moving conveyer belt.  You take want you want, and the final bill is coded by plate color and anything special you order from the waitress.  They also have lunch and dinner specials.  There are also a few dessert specials, like the mango ice cream.  I've tried a variety of both menu and sushi items and never disappointed.  It is real Japanese food.

They serve beer and soda, including Coca Cola.

data.title: Quick and Fresh Sushi
data.text: I love this place- the people are so friendly and Hiro is the best sushi chef. They are very quick with their service. I have tried almost every menu item and usually take sushi and sashimi home for dinner. My daughter and I frequent this place once a week because it is such a great value. It does remind us of the sushi bars in Japan, very intimate and fresh. We usually get a Spider roll, which is made to order and have a pot of Green tea and then pick anything from the conveyor belt. If the whole family is dining we have dessert, Mochi Ice cream, delicious!

data.title: Wonderful sushi and noodle options
data.text: This is a typical small storefront restaurant, much like the ones in Japan.  Although there are a few tables, it's better to sit at the sushi bar where a conveyor belt passes in front of you where dishes of sushi and sashimi pass in front of you for the picking and where you can watch the sushi chef work. There are also many other possibilities that you can order from passing waiters.  Each colored plate has a price from $1 to $5, and the waiter just counts the plates when you are finished and adds them to your bill.  We each started with a half miso soba dish.  It was delicious.  Then we stated in on excellent sushi (several vegetarian options).  My wife ordered a spicy tuna sashimi that she loved.  We ended with green tea ice cream into which the waiter placed a candle as it was my wife's birthday.  Very accommodating!

data.title: 3.5 stars - perhaps I should have tried the sushi
data.text:
I think this restaurant is closed on Mondays - it wasn't opened yesterday.
Today I visited the restaurant and it was opened.
I like the interior décor - feels more like a Japanese restaurant.
Food presentation - shows quite authentic Japanese cuisine. However, the shrimp tempura looks crude - gives the impression that this is a low-end eatery.

The garden salad tastes cold but fresh. However, I can't really say I like the garlic dressing. 
The tempura wasn't that great. The batter is not the type you would get in more upmarket Japanese restaurants. Then again, the food prices here are not expensive.
Ramen overall is pleasant, but I would have liked more bounce to the ramen texture - a tad too soft for my liking. At least this ramen looks like it was cooked from the kitchen and not preheated from supermarket packs.

I noticed most of the clientele here are Asians.
The waitresses are all very energetic and seemingly friendly.

Looking at the other reviews on this restaurant, perhaps I should have tried the sushi over here. Maybe next time.

For an 'authentic' Asian cuisine restaurant, I am tempted to give it 3 stars. But noted that the prices here are reasonably cheap, I'm giving it 3.5 stars.

data.title: Best sushi
data.text: I love this place! They have the best sushi I have ever had! The crunchy dragon roll is my favorite. The dumplings are also some of the best I have had. The prices are good and the staff are very welcoming.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: My husband took me there several years ago. The server knew him as soon as he walked through the door. (I was actually going through old receipts to shred. Found the till dated 2009)

data.title: Decent, relatively inexpensive and interactive
data.text: We've referred to this restaurant as Sushi-Go-Round for years and finally had the time to pop in for lunch. We ordered gyoza and selected various simple rolls from the conveyor belt. Add drinks and a mango ice cream dessert and it was still relatively cheap -- less than $30 for 3 people. Sushi was good, but then again I'm not a connoisseur so I can't speak to how this compares to other sushi places in terms of unique or outstanding rolls. All in all, good sushi option for a college town.

data.title: Family favorite!
data.text: This is a favorite for our family Including 2 teenagers and we visit regularly. Sushi is great, as are the noodles.  Very reasonable prices and relaxed, casual environment. Had a Japanese exchange student visiting a few months ago and he liked it too.

data.title: Sushi on a Conveyor Belt, What More Can You Ask For?
data.text: This place is pretty great. Sushi is reasonably priced, and you can get it right off of the moving belt. I recommend also ordering the Spider Roll, as that is wicked good. I've gotten the mochi a few times, as that's pretty great as well.

data.title: Great food, Relaxed atmosphere
data.text: This is a sushi bar near the UNC campus, so the prices are reasonable, the food is great, and the atmosphere is very laid back.

data.title: Fast, fresh, casual
data.text: Sit at the conveyor belt and grab California rolls as they're set down. We go here for a quick and fulfilling sushi fix. It's not fancy or foodie, but it is inexpensive and satisfying. Good spot for kids. Nice walkable location just off Franklin Street.

data.title: Sampling Different Cuisine
data.text: Having a beautiful spring day, we decided to walk to Chapel Hill from Carrboro to find a place for lunch.  Armed with a map of restaurants, we looked around and decided on a new place--for us--Kurama.  My husband chose a sort of stew with rice, and I had Udon noodles in broth with Chicken Curry on top.  The portions were ample--in fact, I might better have gotten the smaller size.  I had never had Udon noodles before, so that was interesting.  The sushi dishes travel around an area in the middle on a conveyor belt.  Another time we might drive there, and save the wear and tear on old feet and knees!

data.title: Great value
data.text: Great for sushi in a hurry and very affordable. Great location if you're walking around campus. Sushi is not out of the world but it hits the spot. The staff is helpful. We think it is one of the decent sushi places around here considering the difference in food between the more fancy Sushi places and this one is not that much but the price is.

data.title: Really good for the price....but without the price...
data.text: Kurama's seems really good for college students.  Entirely affordable sushi.  That's a good thing.  But for those of us with a bit larger wallet and more discerning taste, it's just all right.  I go there with my kid who really likes it.

data.title: a gem
data.text: Great soups and sandwiches, can count on fresh, healthy cuisine...

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
Nothing special. Avoid.
Seems to be run by UNC students. They don't really even have a sushi chef, just some student making sushi.

data.title: I love this little place!
data.text:
I've enjoyed many meals here with my daughter during her 4 years at UNC-Chapel Hill; I'm sad these days will end when she graduates in the spring.  Kurama is a great little college town eatery, very casual, and always full of college students chatting and enjoying sushi, rice bowls, and yummy green tea ice cream, etc.  Everything on their menu I've tried is very good, and also inexpensive; perfect for college students and those of us who enjoy sushi, but hate to pay out the nose at fancier, upscale establishments.  The sushi chefs know their stuff and the sushi is always fresh.  The restaurant also has a number of yummy authentic menu items found in Japan, but rarely found in Japanese restaurants in the U.S.  
This little place beats about every Japanese/sushi place we've tried in and around Charlotte, NC.....sure wish it was closer to home.
